results.title: Germany a Southern menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
Presents a Southern German meal prepared with flair by master Chef Helmut Abrell, to whom cooking is an art form.

results.title: Cooking of France: an alpine menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
A film which demonstrates that fine French cuisine can be prepared simply, but elegantly, using basic skills and ingredients. Join the amiable Master Chef, Andre Revest, on a tour of his kitchen and his native Dauphiny Alps region.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope Productions

results.title: Spain: a Catalonian menu
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
People who live in areas with large Latin communities may be familiar with Spanish cooking. But the charming chef Carlos Sentis adds his personal touch and keen insights to the food of northern Spain. Includes the preparation of such Catalonian specialties as Sapa de Pescado and Chicken and Lobster Subur style.
results.description:

results.title: Italy: a Venetian menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
In Venice eating is an event, and master chef Giovanni Giero shows you why. With great aplomb he prepares sauces, scampi, pasta and more. Filmed in and around the beautiful city of Venice.

results.title: Finland: a Karelian menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
In Finland, sunlight is at a premium. The precious summer months are a time to celebrate and to harvest the home-grown produce so treasured by the Finns. Master Chef Reijo Rajala insists on using only the freshest ingredients in his cooking. He performs culinary magic with fish, vegetables and pastry dough.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope Productions

results.title: Mexico: a family style menu
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
Joaquin Guzman has been a chef for over twenty-five years. He takes immense pride in his craft, his position and his country’s long history.

results.title: India: a northern menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
Just as India is a rich blend of cultures, Indian cooking is a blend of exotic spices. Chef Simon Fernandes and his assistants unveil some aspects of their ancient cuisine.

results.title: Holland: a traditional menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
Generations ago, a harsh climate and back-breaking farmwork inspired Dutch cooks to develop hearty, nutritious dishes. Much of the hardship has subsided, but the traditional foods are still a favourite with the Dutch. Chef Hans Clemens prepares one mouth-watering meal.

Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.

results.title: Brazil: a Bahian Menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
Brazil is a colourful blend of Portuguese, Indian and West African cultures. The modern cooking of the State of Bahia, where African influence predominates, is famous. Chef Roberto Hein shows creative ways to cook fish, chicken, bananas and other foods.
